terms.definition: The systematic organization, storage, and maintenance of documents and information resources in a centralized system to ensure easy access and version control.
Software as a Service - a cloud-based software delivery model where applications are hosted remotely and accessed via the internet rather than installed locally.
A centralized repository of information, documentation, and resources that provides answers to common questions and solutions to problems.
A system that tracks and manages changes to documents or code over time, allowing users to see revision history and revert to previous versions if needed.
A chronological record of all changes, access, and activities performed on documents or systems, providing accountability and compliance tracking.
The ability for multiple users to work on and edit documents simultaneously, with changes visible to all participants instantly.
The coordination and automation of business processes and tasks, including assignment of responsibilities, tracking progress, and managing deadlines.
The process of examining and interpreting data to identify patterns, trends, and insights that inform decision-making and optimize operations.
Standard Operating Procedures - detailed written instructions that describe how to perform routine tasks consistently and safely within an organization.
The systematic monitoring and documentation of adherence to industry regulations, safety standards, and internal policies.
A single, unified system where all related tools, data, and resources are consolidated for easy access and management from one location.
The process of organizing, assigning, and tracking work activities through their lifecycle from creation to completion.
Systematic records of inspection results, testing procedures, and compliance measures used to ensure products meet specified standards.
Quantifiable measurements used to assess manufacturing performance, including production rates, quality indicators, and efficiency benchmarks.
A centralized storage system where documents are organized, indexed, and made accessible to authorized users with search and retrieval capabilities.
